text.p: Halliburton Co said on Friday it completed its acquisition of Landmark Graphics Corp in a transaction valued at just over $500 million.
Halliburton said in a statement Landmark shareholders approved and adopted the agreement and plan of merger.

The company said it would issue 0.574 of a Halliburton common stock for each outstanding Landmark share. Based on the number of shares outstanding on the August 29 record date, Halliburton said it would issue 10.1 million shares of its common stock to Landmark holders.
It said it would reserve for issuance about 1.8 million shares. These could be issued upon the exercise of Landmark stock options, it said.
Halliburton said Bob Peebler would continue as Landmark's president and chief executive officer.
Landmark would operate as a separate wholly-owned subsidiary and become part of Halliburton's Energy Services business segment, it said.
